instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-01041 liquid damaged
threads.message: Hi, I have a liquid damaged 820-01041 (macbook pro 15 inch touchbar 2018), board looks pretty clean. Doesnt turn on, but is taking a charge 20v and 2.x A. I have no schematics for this board. What other board comes close that is available?

threads.title: 820-01041 liquid damaged
threads.message:
No schematic available.
Does it charge the battery?
2A is high current for non working board.
Did you try to start in SMC bypass mode?
Any USB activity?
Liquid signs around CPU, or backlight area, LCD connector?

threads.title: 820-01041 liquid damaged
threads.message: 2 Amps means it?s turning on...any USB activity or video of any kind?

threads.title: 820-01041 liquid damaged
threads.message: I have the same board with water damage and the exact same problem, it takes 1.4 Amp, turns on and shows an empty battery sign, but doesn't charge the battery(or a new battery) and then turns off and goes to 0 Amp, what is SMC bypass mode? How can I try the SMC bypass mode?

threads.title: 820-01041 liquid damaged
threads.message: Start a new post.....do NOT extend old posts with new ones.....

threads.title: 820-01041 liquid damaged
threads.message: I finally got the boardview and schematics for this board so back at it. Now when I connect the charger, I get 20v and 0.9A. Does this mean the charge circuit works but its not booting?

threads.title: 820-01041 liquid damaged
threads.message:
Which voltages present?
Do you get VCORE?
Check for USB activity.

threads.title: 820-01041 liquid damaged
threads.message:
I checked all the power lines and I am missing PP5V_S4, so I will get started from there. Here are all the readings, 12.63 on PPBUS seems too low?


Charge = 20v    0.08A
PPBUS_G3H = 12.63
PP3V3_G3H = 3.39
PP3V0_G3H = 3v
PP5V_S5 = 5.13v
PP5V_S4 = 0v

threads.title: 820-01041 liquid damaged
threads.message:
Which schematic use for this?
Any pulse at PM_SLP_S5_L?
Check it triggering SMC_ONOFF_L signal.

threads.title: 820-01041 liquid damaged
threads.message:
I have the boardview for 01041 but the schematics that came with it only had 3 pages :(. Anyway, I checked for enable signal P5VG3S_EN and its 3.3, so i tried to replace U7650, now i get 1v at P5VG3S_VFB1, no short, assuming thats the outgoing 5v signal since i dont have schematics.

I will check these other values when im back at office tomorrow, thanks.

threads.title: 820-01041 liquid damaged
threads.message: Upload somewhere the papers you have for this board...

threads.title: 820-01041 liquid damaged
threads.message:
[URL="https://drive.google.com/open?id=1g8xok9p0GewdJvt5FMomqvrV5nH26zBB"]https://drive.google.com/open?id=1g8...omqvrV5nH26zBB[/URL]

Edit: i just got the correct schematics, uploaded it.

threads.title: 820-01041 liquid damaged
threads.message:
"P5VG3S_EN and its 3.3"
In such case, 5V_G3S power supply is enabled.

"i get 1v at P5VG3S_VFB1"
This copuld be good, as is the feedback input.
Check if R7677-79 are good, as their traces too.
Also check R/C7609 and R7665.
Post diode mode on L7600.
